page.title: 01Flyingdales Moor West A171
page.content: The bulk of this block is gently undulating moorland covered mostly by heather species. Thre are no roads so the area is litte visited except by walkers. There is one house and a few grain fields in norht east and about 1.5km of coniferous forest plantation in the north west. The rest is moorland and a small amount of deciduous woodland in NE. The only uses apart from forestry is the few sheep that graze the moors and rough grass in valley. Also bee keeping in the summer and grouse shooting in the winter. It is in the National Park but because it is remote it attracts few tourists, apart form walkers or backpackers, who seem to prefer the less barren landscape or areas closer to the roads.
